title: 113_s1075
content: The "Saving Homeowners from Onerous Rate Escalations Act of 2013" or the "SHORE Act of 2013" extends the phase-in of actuarial rates for flood insurance for certain properties. The National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to include new policies and lapsed policies, with adjustments to clauses and subparagraphs. The National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to include new policies and lapsed policies, with adjustments to clauses and subparagraphs. A phase-in of actuarial rates for flood insurance premiums over an 8-year period is introduced for certain properties or policies. The effective date for certain properties under the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is determined by the date of enactment of the SHORE Act of 2013 or when a property becomes insured, purchased, or renewed. Amendments are made to adjust rates for flood insurance premiums over an 8-year period. Amendments are made to adjust rates for flood insurance premiums over a 10-year period, with a 5 percent increase for the first 5 years and a 15 percent increase for the following 5 years. Amendments are made to adjust rates for flood insurance premiums over a 10-year period, with a phased increase from 5 percent for the first 5 years to 15 percent for the subsequent 5 years. The effective date of any issuance, revision, updating, or other change to a flood insurance map between July 6, 2012, and the date of enactment of this Act will be considered the date of enactment of this Act.
